Pure Mathematics

Proof

- Ref: Mp1
Learning Outcomes: Understand and be able to use the structure of mathematical proof.
Notes: Use methods of proof including proof by deduction and exhaustion. Proceed logically from assumptions to conclusions.
Notation: N/A
Exclusions: N/A

- Ref: p2
Learning Outcomes: Be able to disprove a conjecture by counterexample.
Notes: N/A
Notation: N/A
Exclusions: N/A

- Ref: p3
Learning Outcomes: Understand and be able to use proof by contradiction, including proof of irrationality of 2​ and the infinity of primes.
Notes: Application to unfamiliar proofs included.
Notation: N/A
Exclusions: N/A

Algebra

- Ref: Ma1
Learning Outcomes: Know and be able to use vocabulary and notation appropriate to the subject.
Notes: N/A
Notation: N/A
Exclusions: N/A

- Ref: Ma7
Learning Outcomes: Solve linear inequalities; interpret solutions graphically.
Notes: Examples include y>2x+3.
Notation: N/A
Exclusions: N/A

- Learning Outcomes: Solve quadratic inequalities; interpret graphically.
Note: E.g., x2−4x+3<0.
Notation: N/A
Exclusions: N/A

- Ref: a14
Learning Outcomes: Understand and use proportional relationships and graphs.
Notes: Relationships that are directly or inversely proportional to a power or root.
Notation: N/A
Exclusions: N/A

- Ref: a15
Learning Outcomes: Express algebraic fractions as partial fractions.
Notes: Includes fractions with constant or linear numerators/denominators, quadratic or cubic denominators.
Notation: N/A
Exclusions: N/A

- Ref: a16
Learning Outcomes: Simplify rational expressions—factorising, cancelling, algebraic division.
Notes: Includes division by non-linear expressions, solving polynomial equations of degree > 4.
Notation: N/A
Exclusions: N/A

Functions

- Ref: f3
Learning Outcomes: Understand the definition of a function, vocabulary, notation.
Notes: Basic understanding of functions and their properties.
Notation: f(x), domain, range.
Exclusions: N/A

- Ref: f4
Learning Outcomes: Understand and use composition of functions, including restrictions.
Notes: N/A
Notation: (f∘g)(x).
Exclusions: N/A

- Ref: f5
Learning Outcomes: Understand inverse functions; their graphs, existence conditions, derivation.
Notes: N/A
Notation: f−1(x).
Exclusions: N/A

Graphs

- Ref: MC1
Learning Outcomes: Understand and sketch graphs of functions and transformations.
Notes: Includes intercepts, symmetry, asymptotes, transformations.
Notation: Coordinates (x,y).
Exclusions: N/A

- Ref: C2
Learning Outcomes: Use completing the square to find symmetry and turning points of quadratics.
Notes: y=ax2+bx+c.
Notation: N/A
Exclusions: N/A

- Ref: MC7
Learning Outcomes: Sketch graphs of transformed functions, e.g., y=af(x), y=f(x+a).
Notes: Describe how transformations affect the graph.
Notation: N/A
Exclusions: N/A

Calculus

- Ref: Mc1
Learning Outcomes: Recognize the gradient of a curve equals the gradient of the tangent.
Notes: Limit of the gradient of the secant as the points approach.
Notation: dxdy​, f′(x).
Exclusions: N/A

- Ref: c3
Learning Outcomes: Use derivatives to find tangents, normals, stationary points, optimize.
Notes: Related to rates of change, maxima and minima.
Notation: dxdy​, f′(x).
Exclusions: N/A

Differential Equations

- Ref: c31
Learning Outcomes: Formulate first-order differential equations from real-world rates of change.
Notes: Contexts include kinematics, population, demand.
Notation: dxdy​.
Exclusions: N/A

- Ref: c32
Learning Outcomes: Solve first-order differential equations analytically by separation of variables.
Notes: Factor if necessary.
Notation: N/A
Exclusions: N/A

- Ref: c33
Learning Outcomes: Interpret solutions in problem contexts, understand limitations of models.
Notes: Limitations include assumptions in equations.
Notation: N/A
Exclusions: N/A

Statistics

Statistical Hypothesis Testing

- Ref: MH1
Learning Outcomes: Understand the hypothesis testing process and associated language.
Notes: N/A
Notation: H0​, H1​, p-value, significance level.
Exclusions: N/A

Models and Quantities
